title: System Settings Administration UI
description:
Create Admin Settings Page with System and Clearinghouse Configuration

Build a comprehensive admin settings page that allows authorized administrators to configure system-wide parameters and clearinghouse integration settings.

Requirements:

Access Control:
- Restrict page access to users with admin role/permissions only
- Redirect unauthorized users to appropriate error or login page
- Verify admin privileges on both frontend and backend

Page Structure:
- Organize settings into clearly labeled sections: System Configuration and Clearinghouse Settings
- Use tabs, accordions, or collapsible panels for section organization
- Display current saved values when page loads
- Show last modified timestamp and user for each settings section

System Configuration Section:
- Timezone selection (dropdown of standard timezones)
- Date format preference (e.g., MM/DD/YYYY, DD/MM/YYYY, YYYY-MM-DD)
- Session timeout duration (numeric input with validation for reasonable ranges)
- Maintenance mode toggle (enable/disable with warning)
- Additional system parameters as identified during implementation
- Validate each setting type appropriately (required fields, format, range limits)

Clearinghouse Settings Section:
- API endpoint URL (text input with URL validation)
- Authentication credentials (masked password/token inputs)
- Sync frequency configuration (dropdown or numeric input with time unit)
- Connection timeout settings
- Enable/disable clearinghouse integration toggle
- "Test Connection" button that validates credentials and connectivity without saving
- Display connection status (success/failure with detailed error messages)

Form Handling:
- Validate all inputs client-side before submission
- Display inline validation errors near relevant fields
- Prevent form submission if validation fails
- Show loading state during save operations
- Display success toast/notification on successful save
- Display error messages if save fails with actionable guidance

Data Persistence:
- Save settings to database with transactional integrity
- Store sensitive credentials encrypted (use appropriate encryption method)
- Maintain audit trail: log who changed what settings and when
- Ensure settings are immediately available after save without requiring application restart

User Experience:
- Show confirmation modal for destructive or critical changes (e.g., enabling maintenance mode)
- Provide "Reset to Default" option for individual settings or entire sections
- Indicate unsaved changes when user attempts to navigate away
- Make form responsive for mobile/tablet access
- Ensure accessibility standards (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, screen reader support)

Security:
- Implement CSRF token validation on form submission
- Sanitize all inputs to prevent XSS and SQL injection
- Hash/encrypt sensitive credentials before database storage
- Use HTTPS for all admin settings page requests
- Implement rate limiting on save operations to prevent abuse
- Audit log all configuration changes with user ID, timestamp, and changed values

Testing Considerations:
- Test with valid and invalid input combinations
- Verify permission checks work correctly
- Test clearinghouse connection with both valid and invalid credentials
- Ensure encrypted data can be decrypted and used properly
- Verify audit logs capture all changes accurately
